meanings.definition: A series of promotional events or performances held in various locations.
meanings.sent1: The company organized roadshows to introduce their new product to different cities.
meanings.sent2: I attended a roadshow last week where they showcased the latest technology.
meanings.sent3: The roadshows were so popular that even the pigeons showed up to watch!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a roadshow of joy.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners and lively music made the roadshow unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The art roadshow featured paintings from famous artists around the world.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were amazed by the rare artifacts displayed at the historical roadshow.
meanings.sent3: The roadshow felt like a magical journey through time and culture.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a roadshow of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The interactive exhibits made the roadshow engaging and educational.

meanings.definition: A tour or journey made by a group of people, especially performers or salespeople.
meanings.sent1: The theater group went on a roadshow to perform in different towns.
meanings.sent2: The sales team embarked on a roadshow to promote their new line of products.
meanings.sent3: The roadshow turned into a comedy of errors when the lead actor forgot his lines.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a roadshow of adventures and misadventures.
meanings.sent5: The roadshow across the country was a test of endurance for the performers.
